lines.content: * Represents a task with a deadline.
* A Deadline is a task that needs to be completed by a specific date.
* @param description The description of the task.
* @param by          The date by which the task needs to be completed, in the format "yyyy-MM-dd".
* @throws IllegalArgumentException If the date format is invalid.
throw new IllegalArgumentException("Invalid date format. Please use 'yyyy-MM-dd'.");
* @return A string representing the task type, which is "D" for Deadline.
* Returns additional details for file formatting.
* @return A string containing the date in the format "yyyy-MM-dd".
* Returns the string representation of the Deadline task.
* @return A string representing the Deadline, including its description and due date.
* Represents a task that occurs within a specific period.
* An Event is a task that has a start date and an end date.
* @param description The description of the event.
* @param from        The start date of the event, in the format "yyyy-MM-dd".
* @param to          The end date of the event, in the format "yyyy-MM-dd".
* @throws IllegalArgumentException If the date format is invalid.
public Event(String description, String from, String to) {
throw new IllegalArgumentException("Invalid date format. Please use 'yyyy-MM-dd'.");
* @return A string representing the task type, which is "E" for Event.
* Returns additional details for file formatting.
* @return A string containing the start and end dates in the format "yyyy-MM-dd".
* Returns the string representation of the Event task.
* @return A string representing the Event, including its description and the date range.
* The main class of the Lutchat application.
* This class is responsible for initializing the application, handling user input,
* and managing the flow of the program.
* @param filePath The file path to load and save tasks.
* This method is responsible for greeting the user, handling the input loop, and saving tasks upon exit.
* The main method that serves as the entry point for the Lutchat application.
* @param args Command-line arguments. Not used in this application.
* The Parser class is responsible for interpreting and executing user commands.
* It parses the user input and triggers the appropriate actions in the TaskList.
* Parses the user input and executes the corresponding command.
* @param userInput The user's input as a string.
* @param ui        The Ui object for interacting with the user interface.
* @param taskList  The TaskList object that contains the current list of tasks.
* @param storage   The Storage object responsible for saving and loading tasks.
* @return A boolean indicating whether the application should continue running.
public static boolean parse(String userInput, Ui ui, TaskList taskList, Storage storage) {

* The Storage class is responsible for saving and loading tasks from a file.
* It handles the persistence of tasks between sessions of the application.
* Constructs a Storage object with the specified file path.
* @param filePath The path of the file where tasks are stored.
* Loads tasks from the specified file and returns them as an ArrayList.
* If the file does not exist, an empty task list is returned.
* @return An ArrayList of tasks loaded from the file.
* @throws IOException If an I/O error occurs while reading the file.
* Saves the current list of tasks to the specified file.
* @param taskList The TaskList object containing the tasks to be saved.
System.out.println("Oh no! An error occurred while saving tasks...");
* The Task class represents a task in the task list.
* It serves as an abstract base class for different types of tasks such as Todo, Deadline, and Event.
* Constructs a Task object with the specified description.
* The task is initially marked as not done.
* @param description The description of the task.
* Checks if the task is done.
* @return true if the task is done, false otherwise.
* Marks the task as not done.
* Converts the task to a file-friendly format string.
* @return A string representing the task in a format suitable for file storage.
* Checks if the specified string is contained within the task's description.
* @param str the string to check for within the task's description
* @return true if the description contains the specified string, false otherwise
* Returns the type of the task.
* This method must be implemented by subclasses to specify the task type.
* @return A string representing the type of the task.
* Returns additional details of the task to be included in the file format.
* This method must be implemented by subclasses to specify additional task details.
* @return A string representing additional task details for file storage.
* Returns a string representation of the task.
* The format indicates whether the task is done or not.
* The TaskList class manages a list of tasks.
* It provides methods to add, delete, mark as done, and unmark tasks in the list.
* Constructs a TaskList with a pre-existing list of tasks.
* @param tasks The list of tasks to be managed by this TaskList.
* Retrieves the list of tasks managed by this TaskList.
* Checks if the provided index is valid within the current task list.
* @param index The index to be checked.
* @return true if the index is valid, false otherwise.
* Adds a task to the task list and notifies the user through the UI.
* @param task The task to be added.
* @param ui   The UI to notify the user.
public void addTask(Task task, Ui ui) {
* Deletes a task from the task list at the specified index and notifies the user through the UI.
* If the index is invalid, an error message is shown.
* @param index The index of the task to be deleted.
* @param ui    The UI to notify the user.
public void deleteTask(int index, Ui ui) {
ui.showError("Invalid task index. Please try again.");
* Marks the task at the specified index as done and notifies the user through the UI.
* If the index is invalid, an error message is shown.
* @param index The index of the task to be marked as done.
* @param ui    The UI to notify the user.
public void markTaskAsDone(int index, Ui ui) {
ui.showError("Invalid task index. Please try again.");
* Marks the task at the specified index as not done and notifies the user through the UI.
* If the index is invalid, an error message is shown.

* @param ui    The UI to notify the user.
public void markTaskAsUndone(int index, Ui ui) {
ui.showError("Invalid task index. Please try again.");
* The Todo class represents a task with no additional details beyond the description.
* It is a subclass of Task and represents a simple task to be done.
* Constructs a Todo task with the specified description.
* @param description The description of the todo task.
* Returns the type of the task as a string.
* Returns additional details for the Todo task in a file-friendly format.
* Since Todo tasks have no additional details, this method returns an empty string.
* @return An empty string, as Todo tasks have no additional details.
* Returns a string representation of the Todo task.
* The format includes the task type indicator and the description.
* @return A string representing the Todo task.

* It provides methods to display messages and prompt the user for input.
* Constructs a Ui object with a new Scanner instance.
* Displays a greeting message to the user.
System.out.println("What can I do for you?");

System.out.println("Bye! Hope to see you again soon!");

* Displays a message indicating that a task has been added.
* @param task The task that has been added.
* @param size The updated number of tasks in the list.
public void showTaskAdded(Task task, int size) {
System.out.println("Got it. I've added this task:");
System.out.println("Now you have " + size + " task(s) in the list.");
* Displays a message indicating that a task has been removed.

* @param size The updated number of tasks in the list.
public void showTaskRemoved(Task task, int size) {
